result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Hohensee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Petition for payment of attorney fees
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1:32pm [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Brian L. Hohensee in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Teuber submits Victim Impact Statement

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete  certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $132
--to pay any outstanding attorney fees 


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 1:53pm

Case called at 3:26pm [mo]
Court Reporter: Lisa Zinda
Defendant Brian L. Hohensee in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Rhiel indicates a resolution has not been met and requests a Trial date.
Atty. Rhiel questions a condition of Mr. Hohensee's bond regarding presence at locations that serve alcohol and his employment.
The Court clarifies Mr. Hohensee's conditions of bond.

The Court reduces Mr. Hohensee's monthly payment to $50 per month, payment will still be due on 4/30/15 and on the last day of every month thereafter until paid in full. 
recess:3:33pm

Case called at 1:49 pm [Clerk SH] (On Defense Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Brian L. Hohensee in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Argument by Atty Rhiel in support of motion
ADA Beck informs the Court that the State did speak with Ms. Schuld and she did indicates that she is not opposed to lifting the no contact provision

Court presents basis, grants motion to modify bond and requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence towards any person
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor store
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Ashley Schuld
Recess: 1:55 pm

Second petition for Court appointed attorney
Letter and copy of petition returned to the defendant, not enough information on the form

Case called at 1:17 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brian L. Hohensee appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Hohensee is NOT eligible for SPD Services, appear for bond purposes only

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charge/penalties recited; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-Booking at JESO
-No contact with Ashley Schuld
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
X  EXCEPTION - The Defendant shall be allowed contact with Ms. Schuld on one occasion to obtain personal belongings if it is done upon reasonable notice and conditioned upon supervision by a law enforcement officer. 
Recess: 1:22 pm
